project.teaser: The Distributed System of Scientific Collections (DiSSCo) is a pan-European Research Infrastructure (RI) initiative. DiSSCo aims to bring together natural science collections from 175 museums, botanical gardens, universities and research institutes across 23 countries in a...
project.title: Distributed System of Scientific Collections Transition to ERIC Project
project.keywords: Research Infrastructures, ESFRI, Biodiversity data, Natural Science Collections

article.title: Transitioning DiSSCo to its construction phase

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: "Commentary on ""Preliminary Species Hypotheses"" in Entomological Taxonomy: A Global Data and FAIR Infrastructure Perspective"
Report on state of standards interoperability and gap analysis for next stage of DiSSCo RI development. (M18) (Task 4.1)
result.description: This report will summarise the current state of contemporary data standards that will be required for DiSSCo RI. It will report on the continued testing and evaluation of emerging standards including development of testing plans for pilot integrations with other international infrastructures.

result.title: Navigating taxonomic complexity: A use-case report on FAIR scientific name-matching service usage in ENVRI Research Infrastructures

details.authors: Sharif Islam, Dario Papale, Lucia Vaira, Ilaria Rosati, Johannes Peterseil, Christian Pichot

result.title: Further development of the functionality of ELViS (Task 3.2)
result.description: Expansion of the functionality of ELViS with a service for individual visits: ELViS running in an operational environment managed by MNHN, its users migrated and connected to the AAI core infrastructure component and connected with a new service for supporting individual visits.

result.title: DiSSCo RI: the Cost Book for DiSSCo

details.authors: Salomé Landel, Michel Guiraud, Ana Casino, Katharine Worley

result.title: Project Wrap-up Event (Task 5.3)
result.description: The wrap-up event will mark the end of the DiSSCo Transition Project and provide an excellent opportunity to present its outputs and organise specific sessions to explore the opportunities for exploitation. The deliverable consists of a compendium (e.g., presentations, photos) based on the talks that will take place during the project wrap-up event.

result.title: The key to bringing DNA collections to the next level

details.authors: Veltjen E, Asselman P, Baert W, Baeyen S, Beirinckx L, Breyne L, Brosens D, Claerhout T, Cogneau S, Cox K, Cuypers L, Delgat L, Desmeth P, de Raad J, Esselens L, Eves Down M-R, Helsen P, Leliaert F, Meganck K, Pereboom Z, Smitz N, Sonet G, Trekels M, Vand
Patricia Mergen, Maarten Trekels, Frederik Leliaert

result.title: The genera Chrysilla and Phintelloides revisited with the description of a new species (Araneae, Salticidae) using digital specimen DOIs and nanopublications

details.authors: Christa Deeleman-Reinhold, Wouter Addink, Jeremy Miller

result.title: Model of training resources for the DiSSCo Helpdesk (Task 2.3)
result.description: Model of training resources for users in connection with the DiSSCo Helpdesk: A manual/set of guidelines that will be integrated into the first layer of the DiSSCo Helpdesk, to facilitate understanding, access and exploitation of DiSSCo RI from the users’ perspective, ensuring community and capacity building.

result.title: Report on standards adoption including workshops, current state of geo- collections data mobilisation and documentation for DiSSCo services (Task 4.2)
result.description: This deliverable will develop documentation on DISSCo’s technical services (APIs) and work with technical stakeholders to implement and support the data standards required by DiSSCo RI. It will summarise community engagement on scientific use cases and implementation from workshops with international collaborators and DiSSCo’s National Nodes.

result.title: Participatory schema for DiSSCo NNs (Task 2.1)
result.description: The participatory schema will facilitate shared understanding and vision, consolidate engagement and collaboration, and inform endorsement of DiSSCo requirements and outcomes across the community.

result.title: Dissemination and Exploitation (D&E) Plan, comprising a plan for communication activities (task 5.3)
result.description: This deliverable will present DiSSCo Transition’s main goals for its communication, dissemination and exploitation efforts. The document will also describe the strategy that will orient those efforts to produce increased impact, including key messages and channels that will be used to reach DiSSCo’s main target audiences.

result.title: Minimum Viable Product of Core Infrastructure (Task 3.1)
result.description: Minimum Viable Product of Core Infrastructure with a selected set of relevant data (TRL6): Technology demonstrated in a relevant environment with a representative set of real data, with enough features to attract early-adopter users of DiSSCo RI.

result.title: DiSSCo DMP ready for use in the ERIC (Task 3.3)
result.description: DiSSCo DMP ready for use in the ERIC with supporting documentation and demonstrator for a machine-actionable DMP enabling provenance tracking based on open standards (PROV-O): A fully machine-actionable DMP, aligned with European policy objectives and strategies, to enable flexible integration of all relevant information in the data life cycle and the creation of reports containing structured data. The DMP will be supported with service management documentation for preparing the transition and further development of the DiSSCo data infrastructure and e-services ecosystem for operation under DiSSCo ERIC.

result.title: Integration and adoption roadmap of assessment tools (Task 2.2)
result.description: Roadmap supporting the contribution from participating researchers, institutions and nodes in DiSSCo RI with data through well-grounded tools and identified pathways towards ensuring convergence between organisations, and strategic partnerships.

result.title: Collectomics – towards a new framework to integrate museum collections to address global challenges

details.authors: Julia D. Sigwart, Matthias Schleuning, Angelika Brandt, Markus Pfenninger, Hanieh Saeedi, Thomas Borsch, Eva Häffner, Robert Lücking, Anton Güntsch, Helmuth Trischler, Till Töpfer, Karsten Wesche, Collectomics Consortium

result.title: Data Management Plan (Task 5.1)
result.description: The project’s Data Management Plan (DMP) will outline all aspects of managing data produced for the project, both during and after the project, and under the practices of open science.

result.title: Policy brief (Task 5.3)
result.description: The policy brief will ensure that the project’s impact and contribution to EU policy goals and recommendations can inform future policy and programme developments. Information on project results and outcomes will be provided to the EU policy makers, and links with the other Research Infrastructures/and with the EOSC family will be reported.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
